H0.text: Mitosis is the process during which nuclei are duplicated.

H1.text: Respiration is the process during which nuclei are duplicated.

H2.text: Photosynthesis is the process during which nuclei are duplicated.

H3.text: Fertilization is the process during which nuclei are duplicated.

A4.text: Mitosis is a part of the cell cycle in eukaryotic cells in which replicated chromosomes are separated into two new nuclei.

A5.text: This process ensures that each daughter cell receives an identical set of chromosomes, maintaining genetic stability across cell generations.
